body_html: Yes, we should use basestring. However, I'd really recommend using torch.DoubleTensor directly. It's going to be faster, because it goes around the string parsing (otherwise, we have to get our hands on the tensor ourselves and this involves a bit of work).
body_text: Yes, we should use basestring. However, I'd really recommend using torch.DoubleTensor directly. It's going to be faster, because it goes around the string parsing (otherwise, we have to get our hands on the tensor ourselves and this involves a bit of work).
body: Yes, we should use basestring. However, I'd really recommend using `torch.DoubleTensor` directly. It's going to be faster, because it goes around the string parsing (otherwise, we have to get our hands on the tensor ourselves and this involves a bit of work).
